newsitem.title: USA: Lilly says gets Zyprexa approvable letter.
newsitem.headline: Lilly says gets Zyprexa approvable letter.

text.p: Eli Lilly & Co said it received an approvable letter from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for Zyprexa for the treatment of the symptoms of psychotic disorders.

"Although an FDA approvable letter does not constitute final clearance to market a drug, it does indicate that the FDA is prepared to approve the new drug application upon the satisfaction of specified conditions. Lilly will work with the FDA to obtain final marketing clearance," the company said.
Lilly said it was not asked to present its data to an FDA advisory board before receiving the approvable letter.
The FDA has been reviewing a new drug application for Zyprexa, or olanzapine, since September 21, 1995, Lilly said.
The drug is designed to treat schizophrenia.
